org.codefx.demo.javadoc8tags

Interface Lottery

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OldLottery, PrivateLottery, StateLottery, UselessLottery

    public interface Lottery
    The lottery.

    "Here's something to think about: How come you never see a headline like 'Psychic Wins Lottery'?" (Jay Leno)

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default List<String> pickWinners(Set<String> players)
      Picks the winners from the specified set of players.

    • Method Detail

      • pickWinners

        default List<String> pickWinners(Set<String> players)
        Picks the winners from the specified set of players.

        The returned list defines the order of the winners, where the first prize goes to the player at position 0. The list will not be null but can be empty.

        API Note:
        This method was added after the interface was released. It is defined as a default method for compatibility reasons. From version 1.2 on, the method will be abstract and all implementations of this interface have to provide their own implementation of the method.
        Implementation Requirements:
        The default implementation will consider each player a winner and return them in an unspecified order.
        Implementation Note:
        This implementation has linear runtime and does not filter out null players.
        Parameters:
        players - the players from which the winners will be selected
        Returns:
        the (ordered) list of the players who won; the list will not contain duplicates
        Since:
        1.1
